title: dog news Yulin Ellen DeGeneres Cameron Diaz Ricky Gervais Simon Cowell
story: Chinese city of Yulin has become a byword for the horrors of dogs being butchered for their meat.While mid-summer sees the Chinese city of Yulin become a byword for the horrors of dogs being butchered for their meat, the street markets of North Sulawesi are witnessing even more shocking scenes in full gaze of families.Heartbreaking footage of cats and dogs enduring indescribable horrors today saw the galaxy of celebrities writing to Indonesia&rsquos president, calling for him to stop the cruelty.Among the British stars to sign the letter are Brian May, Dame Judi Dench, Ricky Gervais, Simon Cowell, Alfie Boe, Peter Egan and Paul O&rsquoGrady.American celebrities Cameron Diaz, Courtney Cox, Ellen DeGeneres Joaquin Phoenix, David Duchovny and Owen Wilson added their signatures alongside footballers Dwight Yorke and Gianfranco Zola as well as Indonesian celebrities.Korean meat farm show: Haunting cries of dogs before they are freedBLOW-TORCHED &ndash this is how China celebrates the Year of the dogThe stellar list is supporting the campaign launched by Dog Meat-Free Indonesia, a coalition of animal welfare campaign groups outraged by the scenes that have emerged after an investigation into what is happening to the country&rsquos cats and dogs.In their letter to Indonesian President Joko Widodo, the celebrities state: &ldquoWe were horrified by the findings of nationwide investigations by the Dog Meat-Free Indonesia coalition, documenting the horrific reality of the trade: more than one million dogs and cats are transported throughout Indonesia to supply markets, slaughterhouses and restaurants.&ldquoThese animals, many of them stolen pets, are subjected to crude and brutal methods of capture, transport and slaughter, and the immense suffering and fear they must endure is heartbreaking and absolutely shocking.&ldquoThe footage from markets in North Sulawesi is deplorable, and clearly documents the routine use of brutal handling and killing, including repeatedly bludgeoning animals over the head, killing animals in front of their terrified cage-mates, and blowtorching dogs while they are still alive.American celebrities Cameron Diaz, Courtney Cox, Ellen DeGeneres added their signatures. &ldquoWe are sure you will agree that the level of brutality towards these dogs and cats is shocking and demands your urgent attention.Besides the animal cruelty, campaigners are also highlighting both the public health risks from the spread of rabies as well as the mounting violence as desperate gangs forcibly take dogs from their owners to sell to the meat trade.The Express recently revealed some of the footage gathered during the DMFI investigation at two of North Sulawesi&rsquos estimated 200 traditional animal markets.Lola Webber, DMFI campaign coordinator and Change For Animals Foundation founder, described the horrors she witnessed.An estimated 11,000 cats and dogs are due to be slaughtered for the annual Yulin Dog Meat Festival in China                    AFPGetty Images1 of 21Puppies are seen in a cage at a dog meat market in Yulin, in China's southern Guangxi region&ldquoThe animals we saw at the markets were terrified and often sick and injured, after surviving gruelling journeys to market and rough handling by traders, she explained.&ldquoIt was like walking through hell. They huddled together in cages, trembling with fear as they watched others being killed around them, waiting their turn.&ldquoThe sight of absolute terror in their eyes, the thumping of the club as they were bludgeoned, their screams of pain, and the smell of burning hair and flesh, were appalling and unforgettable.Today, she added: &ldquoThis year, 2018, marks the Year of the Dog, and we stand united in our call on the central and provincial governments of Indonesia to take action against the dog meat trade to show the world that animal cruelty will not be tolerated, and to safeguard both animal and human health and safety.Her comments were echoed by Humane Society International President Kitty Block, who paid tribute to the celebrities backing the DMFI campaign.&ldquoWe are so grateful to these global and Indonesian superstars who have come together to support Dog Meat-Free Indonesia&rsquos efforts to end this cruel and dangerous industry, and we respectfully urge President Widodo to work with us on a solution that protects not only Indonesia&rsquos dogs and cats but also the health of its people, she said.The DMFI coalition is made up from Animal Friends Jogja, Change for Animals Foundation, Humane Society International, Jakarta Animal Aid Network and FOUR PAWS.Karin Franken, director of Jakarta Animal Aid Network, added: &ldquoMost people in Indonesia don&rsquot eat dog and cat meat. In fact, many Indonesians are highly critical of the trade because of the growing concerns for animal welfare, high incidence of dog theft and the fear created by the gangs who steal dogs from the streets and people&rsquos homes.

title: conservation extinction animals mankind University of Queensland
story: PAA global area 20 times the size of the British Isles has been impacted by road-building.Protecting land from the footprints of humanity is essential for saving natural landscapes with their wild animals and flora, and this has seen governments setting vast areas aside for nature over the past 25 years.Yet while on maps the global extent of protection now covers 15 per cent of the planet&rsquos surface - with a goal of 17 per cent coverage by 2020 - a new study in the journal Science reveals how 32.8 per cent of the 202,000 sites are highly degraded.Scientists say their research into the impact of &ldquohuman footprints on these areas will prove a reality check to governments striving to meet commitments under the Convention on Biological Diversity.Experts from the University of Queensland, Wildlife Conservation Society (WCS) and University of British Columbia are warning that CBD goals will be severely undermined if widespread human pressures continue inside protected areas.                Norway's wolves could be eradicated by law change, activists fume                DOOMSDAY REPORT: Extinction WARNING for planet&rsquos wildlifeInternational Union for Conservation of Nature have announced the latest list of at-risk species                    Pa1 of 9Diademed siafaka, a type of lemur Kendall Jones, from the University of QueenslandWhile these oases are purportedly being protected for nature, in reality, warns the study, governments are overestimating the space available, a major reason why bioersity is in catastrophic decline.Kendall Jones, from the University of Queensland and the paper&rsquos lead author, warned: &ldquoA well-run protected area network is essential in saving species. If we allow our protected area network to be degraded there is no doubt bioersity losses will be exacerbated.The worst hit protected areas were in Africa, Asia and Europe in parts with massive human populations.Yet the authors are not calling for these nature sanctuaries to be stripped or lose funding. They say it is crucial for nations to understand the conservation benefits available from restoring protected areas while still respecting the needs of the local population.The worst hit protected areas were in Africa, Asia and Europe in parts with massive human populationProfessor James Watson of WCS and University of Queensland, and the study&rsquos senior author, explained: &ldquoWe know protected areas work.&ldquoWhen well-funded, well-managed and well placed, they are extremely effective in halting the threats that cause bioersity loss and ensure species return from the brink of extinction.&ldquoThere are also many protected areas that are still in good condition and protect the last strongholds of endangered species worldwide. The challenge is to improve the management of those protected areas that are most valuable for nature conservation to ensure they safeguard it.&ldquoMost importantly we&rsquove got to recognise that these jewels in the crown need support. There are some protected areas that are safeguarding nature and that still haven&rsquot got any evidence of human encroachment in them. We must ensure these values are maintained.

title: elephant news Chester Zoo born animal news pictures
story: Chester ZooKeepers and scientists had given up hope on the youngster&rsquos arrival.Mother Asian elephant Thi Hi Way was showing signs of returning to her normal weight after over-running her pregnancy at Chester Zoo by three months.The youngster was due to be the 35 year old matriarch&rsquos seventh calf but because elephants can resorb their unborn babies as part of a natural survival process, keepers feared she had called time on the pregnancy.Zoo staff say they astonished when the healthy male calf suddenly put in a surprise appearance this week after being carried by his mother for a marathon 766 days.The baby, seen here playing in the mud under his mother&rsquos watchful eye, has yet to be named, but conservationists say his arrival is another positive step in ongoing efforts to save Asian elephants.Cancer resistant genes in elephants also found in HUMANSNational Elephant Day: Top 10 facts about the gentle giantUK outlaws sales of all ivory goods to save elephants from extinctionChester ZooThe calf was carried by it's mother for a marathon 766 days.Poaching for ivory, habitat loss, disease and conflict with humans because the animals wander into farmland in search for food are all conspiring to bring about the demise of a species already officially listed as endangered.Mike Jordan, Chester Zoo&rsquos Collections Director, said: &ldquoThi is a wonderful matriarch to our family herd and a really experienced mother.&ldquoShe has successfully given birth to calves before, but this time around circumstances were really quite astonishing.&ldquoWe believed Thi had exceeded her normal gestation period, which we were monitoring closely.Fun facts about elephants for world elephant day.                    Getty Images1 of 10African elephants are the largest land mammals on the planet&ldquoHer hormone levels, behaviour and drop in weight gave us every indication that she may have been resorbing the calf, a natural process that some elephants experience.&ldquoHowever, nature always has that incredible ability to surprise you and that was certainly the case when we came in and new youngster was up on his feet, suckling from mum and bonding closely with the rest of the family herd. It&rsquos truly magnificent to witness.Chester Zoo says mother and calf are doing well and the elephant house is open as usual.For the zoo&rsquos conservation staff, the calf&rsquos arrival is another &ldquohuge boost in its widespread strategy to save the Asian elephant.Besides its breeding programme, part of a pan-European effort to sustain the population, Chester Zoo scientists have been working in Assam state in India for more than a decade to successfully eliminate conflict between local communities and the resident elephant population.Zoo experts are also leading in global efforts to develop a cure for endotheliotropic herpesvirus, a haaemorrhagic disease with high rates of mortality in young elephants.Tim Rowlands, Curator of Mammals at the zoo, added: &ldquoIt&rsquos absolutely magical to see Thi bring another new arrival into the world.&ldquoThese momentous events always bring the entire elephant family together and we expect to see the other young calves in the group showing a lot of interest in the little one over the coming days, weeks and months.Chester ZooChester Zoo says mother and calf are doing well and the elephant house is open as usual.&ldquoCrucially, this is important news for Asian elephants more widely. The species is endangered in the wild. If we don&rsquot act now then the unthinkable could happen.&ldquoBy combining our breeding programme successes with field projects in the wild, we are really making a difference for these magnificent animals.

title: animal extinction salamander chinese delicacy chicken
story: ZSL  The Chinese giant salamander is said to taste like chicken.Despite being embedded in Chinese myth and folklore, with the iconic yin and yang symbols for opposites supposedly representing two salamanders entwined, the 6ft-long amphibian is now so desired by epicures that its 170 million history is in peril.Four years of research across 97 known Chinese strongholds show how the striking muddy brown salamander &ndash affectionately known as &ldquowa wa yu or baby fish as their distress calls are said to sound like a crying child &ndash has all but vanished from its freshwater haunts.Although the Chinese authorities prohibit the hunting of the salamander &ndash scientific name Andrias davidianus &ndash the country&rsquos ministry of agriculture allows the widespread release of farmed animals to aid its conservation.This practice, warn conservationists, may be harmful to wild populations as it risks spreading disease and mixing genetic lineages.                Last bastions of nature are being defiled by the march of mankindDr Samuel Turvey, from ZSL&rsquos Institute of ZoologyTo add to the wild population&rsquos parlous state, salamanders are also being routinely harvested from the wild to stock commercial breeding farms.After a landmark study into the near blind salamanders, published today in the journal Current Biology and which has seen scientists from ZSL (Zoological Society of London) working with Chinese colleagues, there are calls for captive breeding of genetically distinct lineages to assist their conservation.Study co-author Dr Samuel Turvey, from ZSL&rsquos Institute of Zoology, said today: &ldquoThe overexploitation of these incredible animals for human consumption has had a catastrophic effect on their numbers in the wild over an amazingly short time-.&ldquoUnless coordinated conservation measures are put in place as a matter of urgency, the future of the world&rsquos largest amphibian is in serious jeopardy.These incredible pictures show some of the worlds most beautiful but vulnerable creatures - teetering on the brink extinction, including British butterfly, Small Copper.                    Will Stewart 1 of 29An amazing capture of an endangered Pallas wildcat ZSLThe 6ft-long amphibian is now so desired by epicures that its 170 million history is in peril.Some distinct salamander lineages may have already disappeared, according to a related study led by Kunming Institute of Zoology with ZSL and the Royal Ontario Museum, which has discovered how the species consists of five genetic groups.Co-author Dr Fang Yan from KIZ said: &ldquoTogether with addressing wider pressures such as poaching for commercial farms and habitat loss, it&rsquos essential that suitable safeguards are put in place to protect the unique genetic lineage of these amazing animals, which dates back to the time of the dinosaurs.

title: royal wedding 2018 pippa middleton arizona ice tea dress
story: ARIZONA ICED TEAPippa Middleton was compared to an Arizona Iced TeaThe sister to the Duchess of Cambridge arrived wearing a mint green dress with pale pink flowers as she was joined by her husband James Matthews.Twitter users from across the pond were quick to point out that the pattern of her dress looked identical to a can of Arizona Green Tea with Ginseng and Honey.The drink, found in petrol stations and supermarkets and is known for costing just 99 cents, was shared alongside a photo of Pippa&rsquos Royal Wedding day outfit.Spooky Island @dimiginger_mars tweeted: &ldquoPippa Middleton sponsored by Arizona #RoyalWedding.                Pippa Middleton shows off baby bump as she arrives with husband James Another user, Laura @shylaura, tweeted: &ldquoWho wore it Better, Pippa Middleton or Arizona Green Tea? #RoyalWeddingEven the brand, Arizona, joined in on the Twitter jokes.AriZona Iced Tea, @DrinkAriZona, tweeted: &ldquoPippa got you feelin&rsquo thirsty?! Stop by the Great Buy 99 Pop-Up for a free can of the real thing! #royalwedding #GreatBuy99 #nyc #arizonaicedtea.The 34-year-old looked chic in her floral dress and extravagant fascinator.&nbspThe dress is from The Fold and costs &pound495.Pippa also had an extravagant fascinator with a massive flower and netting on the top.She paired the dress and fascinator with blush pink stilettos shoes and a small pink clutch bag.Pippa was joined by her husband James, who wore a morning suit and a silk pink tie.Meghan Markle bares a striking similarity to Pippa Middleton, take a look and see.                    PA&bullGetty1 of 11Pippa Middleton and Meghan Markle bare a striking similarityJames was seen carrying a bouquet of pink peonies.Pippa is believed to be pregnant and is most known for almost stealing the show during her sister&rsquos marriage to Prince William in 2011 after wearing a bridesmaid&rsquos dress that made her bum an unforgettable talking point.Even though Pippa&rsquos wedding last year was remarkably different to Meghan&rsquos, there was one big similarity - Prince George and&nbspPrincess Charlotte were in the wedding.Pippa Middleton with her husband James MatthewPrince George, four, was one of four page boys along with Jasper Dyer, six, Brian Mulroney, seven, and John Mulroney, seven.&nbspPrincess Charlotte, three, was one of six bridesmaids along with Florence van Custem, three, Remi Litt, six, Rylan Lott, seven, Ive Mulroney, four, and Zalie Warren, two.

title: Meghan markle prince harry fashion gown advice royal wedding
story: Much was made of Meghan's Royal Wedding dress that was designed by Givenchy, which she wore during the Royal Wedding at St George's Chapel on Saturday.But heads were turned once again when she stepped out of Windsor Castle in her second outfit of the evening &ndash a dazzling Stella McCartney lillywhite dress.Meghan reportedly took her then husband-to-be to several fittings at Kensington Palace, where she settled on the one-off number.A source told The Sun: &ldquoMeghan brought Harry along to get his seal of approval and was asking his opinion on everything she was trying on.Meghan Markle stunned in a Stella McCartney gown                Meghan Markle wedding dress: Get the look for less                Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton&rsquos reception gowns comparedHarry wisely agreed that he liked everything and commented that fashion isn't really his forte.Amal Clooney, 40, and Oprah Winfrey, 64, also wore Stella McCartney dresses for the Windsor ceremony.As well as the slinky Stella McCartney number, the Duchess of Sussex sported a dazzling Avery aquamarine ring on her right hand - a ring once belonging to Princess Diana.Harry appears to have given his bride the poignant wedding day gift as her something blue.Meghan Markle stunned the world with her slinky Stella McCartney evening gownMeghan wore the impressive, emerald cut aquamarine ring on her right hand as the couple made their way to their evening reception.Harry, who drove Meghan through the Windsor Great Park in the early evening sunshine, was dressed in black tie and looked proud as he opened the car door for his new wife.Kensington Palace said: &ldquoThe Bride's evening dress is designed by Stella McCartney and is a bespoke lily white high neck gown made of silk crepe.&ldquoThe Bride is wearing shoes from Aquazurra made in silky satin, with nude mesh, with soles painted in baby blue.&ldquoMs. Markle's hair has been styled for the Evening Reception by George Northwood.The couple travelled from Windsor Castle to Frogmore House in a silver blue Jaguar E-Type Concept Zero on loan to the couple from the car manufacturer.The vehicle was originally manufactured in 1968 and has since been converted to electric power.And in a nod to the couple's wedding date, the number plate read: E190518.

title: royal wedding best photography procession carriage prince harry meghan markle
story: PAYUI MOKThe photo is considered to be one of he best taken at the Royal WeddingThe image shows the couple inadvertently making a heart shape from the way they are sitting.Press Association photographer Yui Mok, like many agency photographers capturing the wedding, was assigned a special vantage point to take photographs from.Mr Mok has been a Royal photographer for the Press Association since 2000.He was assigned a position on the roof of the George IV Gateway of Windsor Castle, and had a split second to snap the carriage as it passed underneath the grate on which he stood.                Bride-to-be BLOWN away by shock BLIZZARD on her wedding day                 Stun at the winners of best destination wedding photos The snapper took the now world-famous image with a Canon 1Dx Mk2 camera and a 70-200mm lens.He was also carrying a Cannon Pro Network 600mm F4 for other shots that day.Talking to fans on Twitter, Mr Mok said: I was positioned on the roof of George IV Gateway of Windsor Castle, and they passed directly beneath me during their carriage processionI had less than a one-second window to take that particular shot - whilst having to focus through a metal grill I was standing over - so was happy to get anything really!PAYUI MOKThe now famous shot of Harry and Meghan was taken in a 'split second'When asked by a fan if capturing the heart shape was intended or coincidental, Mr Mok admitted that it was a case of being in the right place at the right time.He tweeted back to a user: Purely coincidental. I had less than a one-second window to take that particular shot - whilst having to focus through a metal grill I was standing over - so was happy to get anything really!Twitter users gushed over the photo, pointing out that Harry and Meghan's bodies formed a heart shape inside the Ascot Landau carriage.He also pointed out to fans tha &ldquodrones would never have been allowed anywhere near' the wedding.Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's royal wedding procession in pictures.                    REUTERS1 of 17Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding procession in picturesIn fact, drones were banned for the whole day in the area above WindsorMr Mok then told Twitter users he made sure the PA photo desk received the credit, who were working long hours as the wedding day unfolded.He said: The photo desk crop and tidy up the raw images that we send to them directly from our cameras on big jobs like this, before they are issued to the wider world.They tend to be unsung, whilst photographers end up grabbing all the glory.

title: meghan markle prince harry royal wedding pictures kensington palace
story: JONATHAN BOOKMASTERMeghan Markle and Prince Harry pictured for the first time since their Royal WeddingMeghan Markle and Prince Harry&nbspwere photographed wearing shades as they returned to Kensingston Palace this afternoon.&nbspThe pair looked delighted after their weekend to remember, which saw them tie the knot at St George's Chapel in Windsor.&nbspThe pair both wore sunglasses as they drove home from the Royal Wedding today, with Harry behind the wheel.&nbspMeghan was shown wearing a nude-coloured top and her wedding earrings while Harry wore a casual blue top.&nbspRoyal wedding highlights: The best photos of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding day.                    Getty Images1 of 45Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding in picturesThe pair were both smiling and wore a newlywed glow as they arrived at Kensington Palace at 3.30pm.&nbspIt comes after Kensington Palace released three new&nbspRoyal Wedding photos&nbspas a 'thank you' from Meghan and Harry to their well-wishers.&nbspThe images were released by celebrity photographer Alexi Lubomirski, who said it has been an &ldquohonour and privilege to capture the pair from their engagement to wedding.He said: &ldquoIt has been an incredible honour and privilege to document The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's inspiring journey of love, hope and family.EPAMeghan Markle, Prince Harry and their bridesmaids and page boysFrom the engagement photos, all the way through to the official wedding and family portraits on Saturday.This has been a beautiful chapter in my career and life, that I will happily never forget.Next up for the newlyweds is a Buckingham Palace garden party tomorrow held to mark the Prince of Wales' 70th birthday.&nbsp

title: royal wedding official photograph prince harry meghan markle windsor castle pictures
story: Alexi LubomirskiPARoyal wedding: Harry and Meghan's official wedding snaps - who's who?The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have released three shots snapped by wedding photographer Alexi Lubomirski shortly after they arrived at Windsor Castle following their carriage procession.The pictures were released this afternoon along with a statement from Kensington Palace which thanked everyone who had helped the couple celebrate their special day.Photographer Mr Lubomirski said: It has been an incredible honour and privilege to document The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's inspiring journey of love, hope and family from the engagement photos, all the way through to the official wedding and family portraits on Saturday.&ldquoThis has been a beautiful chapter in my career and life, that I will happily never forget.Here is a run-down of who&rsquos who in the pictures, and their relationship to the bride and groom:                The best photo from the Royal Wedding: How photographer captured TH...                Meghan Markle and Harry FIRST PICTURE as newlyweds arrive home1. Camilla Parker Bowles, the Duchess of CornwallCamilla married Prince Charles in 2005 and is Harry&rsquos stepmother.2. Pageboy Jasper Dyer, Harry&rsquos godsonThe six-year-old is the son of Amanda and Mark Dyer.Mr Dyer is close to Harry having worked as an equerry to the prince in the mid-1990s.3. Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh97-year-old Philip is Harry&rsquos grandfather.4. Pageboy Brian MulroneyThe seven-year-old is the son of Meghan's best friend Jessica and her husband Benedict Mulroney.Jessica met Meghan in 2011 when Meghan first moved to Toronto to begin filming Suits.Alexi LubomirskiPAMeghan and Harry with their bridesmaids and page boysThis official wedding photograph released by the Duke and Duchess of Sussex shows The Duke and Duchess in The Green Drawing Room, Windsor Castle with their pageboys and bridesmaids.1 of 115. Bridesmaid Ivy MulroneyThe four-year-old is Brian&rsquos younger sister, and the youngest child of Meghan&rsquos best friend Jessica.6. Bridesmaid Florence van CutsemThree-year-old Florence is Prince Harry's goddaughter.She is the daughter of Alice van Cutsem and Major Nicholas van Cutsem, two of William and Harry&rsquos closest friends.Florence&rsquos older sister, Grace, is the goddaughter of Prince William.Grace famously stole the show at William and Kate's Royal Wedding in 2011 when photos of little Grace looking less than impressed on Buckingham Palace's balcony.7. Prince CharlesHarry&rsquos father and Meghan&rsquos father-in-law stands next to his wife, Camilla.Prince Charles played a large part in the wedding and walked Meghan down part of the aisle at St George's Chapel.Alexi LubomirskiPAMeghan and Harry posed for a picture on the East Terrace of Windsor Castle8. Queen Elizabeth IIHarry&rsquos grandmother hosted the couple's afternoon reception at St George's Hall with 600 guests enjoying food and drink prepared by Buckingham Palace's kitchen.9. Prince Harry, the Duke of Sussex33-year-old Harry was awarded his new title by the Queen.He has been in a relationship with Meghan Markle since June 2016&nbspand popped the question in November 2017.The newlyweds will live in Harry&rsquos cottage in the grounds of Kensington Palace.10. Meghan Markle, the Duchess of SussexThe only previous Duke of Sussex was married twice, but neither of his marriages were approved by his father, George III, and were considered unlawfulThis means Meghan, 36, is the first woman entitled to use the title HRH The Duchess of Sussex.11. Doria RaglandMeghan&rsquos mother and Harry&rsquos mother-in-law.The 61-year-old was the only member of the bride&rsquos family to attend Saturday&rsquos Royal Wedding.Royal wedding highlights: The best photos of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding day.                    Getty Images1 of 45Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding in pictures12. Prince William, the Duke of CambridgeHarry&rsquos brother and Meghan&rsquos brother-in-law.William, 35, served as his younger brother&rsquos best man on Saturday, just as Harry had done at William&rsquos wedding at Westminster Abbey seven years ago.13. Duchess of CambridgeHarry&rsquos sister-in-law.Kate, 36, was spotted at Saturday&rsquos ceremony wearing a huge citrine stone ring, which is said to have been given to her by Prince William after the birth of their third child, Prince Louis, last month.14. Bridesmaid Princess CharlottePrince Harry's niece stole the show as she waved to the crowds.The toddler, who turned three earlier this month, is the second child of Prince William, the Duke of Cambridge, and Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge.15. Pageboy Prince George.Harry's nephew is the third-in-line to the throne.The four-year-old is William and Kate&rsquos eldest child.16.&nbspPageboy&nbspRylan LittThe seven-year-old is Meghan&rsquos goddaughter.Meghan has previously referred to Rylan and her sister Remi as her &ldquofairy goddaughters.17. Pageboy John MulroneyMeghan&rsquos best friend&rsquos son. His twin brother Brian is seated next to Prince Philip.John can be seen casually leaning into a second official image featuring just Meghan, Harry and the bridesmaids and page boys.18. Bridesmaid Zalie WarrenPrince Harry's goddaughter and the youngest bridesmaid.The two-year-old is the daughter of Zoe Warren and Jake Warren, who are close to the Royal Family because of their links to horse racing.Harry and Jake grew up together and both attended Ludgrove Preparatory School and Eton College.19. Bridesmaid Remi LittThe six-year-old is Meghan&rsquos goddaughter and the daughter of Benita Litt and Darren Litt.Benita is one of Meghan&rsquos best friends. The two are so close, the Duchess of Sussex spent Christmas with her family in 2016.

title: Meghan Markle Prince Harry royal wedding pictures bridesmaids pageboys pictures
story: The pictures were captured by fashion photographer Alexi Lubomirski, who also took the romantic photographs marking their engagement.One picture shows the royal couple in Windsor Castle's Green Drawing Room alongside Meghan's mother, Doria Ragland, and Harry's father, Prince Charles.It also includes a proud Queen Elizabeth II and her husband Prince Philip sitting alongside together with Harry's elder brother Prince William, his wife Kate Middleton and Charles's second wife Camilla.A second photograph has just the royal couple with the bridesmaids and pageboys, including a beaming Prince George and a cute Princess Charlotte posing for the camera. The third was a stunning black and white photograph of the newlyweds taken on the castle's East Terrace.The bridesmaids included Brian and John's sister Ivy, 4, 3-year-old Princess Charlotte, daughter of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, two of Prince Harry's goddaughters, Florence van Cutsem, 3, and Zalie Warren, 2, and two goddaughters of Meghan.The four Pages also included Prince George, 4, oldest child of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, and Harry's godson Jasper Dyer. The boys were wearing uniforms drawing their insignia from the Blues and Royals, an old Regiment of The Duke of Cambridge and Prince Harry.

title: meghan markle prince harry royal wedding official pictures bridesmaids page boys windsor
story: The photographs, taken by Alexi Lubomirski in the Green Drawing Room of Windsor Castle look the eptiome of magnificance, perhaps because the images aren&rsquot quite perfect.The Duke and Duchess of Sussex look regal but relaxed for the stunning pictures, which include the Queen and Prince Philip sitting in front of Prince Charles and Camilla and Meghan&rsquos mother Doria Ragland.They are surrounded by their six bridesmaids and four page boys, who had just walked hand in hand down the aisle of St George&rsquos Chapel behind Meghan.One bridesmaid, however, was forced to share her bouquet.TWITTER@KensingtonRoyalMeghan Makrle and Prince Harry surrounded by their bridesmaids and page boys                Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's official wedding pictures: Who's who?                Royal wedding photos: Meghan shocks in &rsquosubmissive&rsquo pose beside HarryThis official wedding photograph released by the Duke and Duchess of Sussex shows The Duke and Duchess in The Green Drawing Room, Windsor Castle with their pageboys and bridesmaids.1 of 11Ivy Mulroney, four, who is the daughter of Meghan&rsquos best friend Jessica Mulroney, did not have a bouquet as she walked down the aisle. Instead she held hands with Rylan and Remi Litt, aged seven and six.So she took hold of Florence Van Custem&rsquos flowers for the official pictures, with Florence, three, reaching over to share them with her.And Florence was seen without a bouquet at all when she sat on the front right for the second photograph, while Ivy posed with the posy next to Prince George.Ivy was also seen without a flower garland, with just a select few white roses in her hair, in contrast to her other bridesmaids.TWITTER@KensingtonRoyalMeghan and Harry with the Windsor's, Doria Ragland and their bridesmaids and page boysFlorence didn&rsquot seem too bothered and grinned for the cameraman, despite earlier looking a little more non-plussed by the day.She attracted the name &lsquoFed-up Flo&rsquo as she appeared to take the baton from her sister &ndash dubbed Grumpy Grace for her glum looks when she was bridesmaid for Prince William and Kate&rsquos wedding in 2011.She captured the attention of the world when she was photographed looking surly as the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge shared their first kiss as a married couple on the balcony of Buckingham Palace.Harry and Meghan&rsquos the three official photographs, taken following the carriage procession, have captured a couple in love.TWITTER@KensingtonRoyalMeghan and Harry&rsquos official Royal Wedding photographA Kensington Palace spokesperson said:The Duke and Duchess of Sussex would like to thank everyone who took part in the celebrations of their wedding on Saturday.&ldquoThey feel so lucky to have been able to share their day with all those gathered in Windsor and also all those who watched the wedding on television across the UK, Commonwealth, and around the world.Their Royal Highnesses are delighted with these official portraits taken by Alexi Lubomirski and are happy to be able to share them today. They would also like to say thank you for all of the generous messages of support they have received.Harry and Meghan made the decision to chose the children of some of their closest friends to be the bridesmaids and page boys for their wedding.Photographer Alexi Lubomirski, who also took the Harry and Meghan&rsquos official engagement portraits, said: It has been an incredible honour and privilege to document The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's inspiring journey of love, hope and family from the engagement photos, all the way through to the official wedding and family portraits on Saturday.&ldquoThis has been a beautiful chapter in my career and life, that I will happily never forget.

title: the queen news chelsea flower show royal wedding princess anne pictures
story: The Queen arrived at the Chelsea Flower Show wearing a stunning pale pink coat, white gloves and a classic string of pearls.Her Majesty was greeted on the grounds of the Royal Hospital Chelsea in London by the President of the Royal Horticultural Society, Sir Nicholas Bacon.The 92-year-old was beaming as she was shown this year's blooms.The Queen was accompanied by other members of the Royal Family including her daughter Princess Anne, the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester, and Princess Alexandra.The Queen arrives at the Chelsea Flower Show in first official engagement since Royal Wedding                The Queen opens Frogmore House to the public after the Royal WeddingHer son Prince Andrew and her granddaughter Princess Beatrice arrived at the flower show earlier this afternoon as did Sophie, the Countess of Wessex.The event is Her Majesty&rsquos first royal engagement since she attended the Royal Wedding of her grandson Prince Harry to Meghan Markle with her husband Prince Philip on Saturday.The 96-year-old Duke of Edinburgh officially retired from royal duties last year and did not join the Queen at the flower show today.The Queen toured the gardens and see displays, including The RHS Feel Good Garden, which celebrates 70 years of the National Health Service and highlighting.The RHS Chelsea Flower Show is a garden show held for five days by the Royal Horticultural Society in the grounds of the Royal Hospital Chelsea in Chelsea, London. It has been been held at since 1912 and runs this year from 22 May to 26 May 2018                    REUTERS1 of 14Queen Elizabeth attends the Chelsea Flower Show 2018 in LondonThe garden created by Matthew Keightley, head designer for Rosebank Landscaping, highlights the positive impact of horticulture on mental health.Her Majesty also viewed the Welcome to Yorkshire Garden, inspired by the Yorkshire Dales, the Wuhan Water Garden, China, which showcases the natural landscape of Hubei Province, and the Morgan Stanley garden for the NSPCC.Sophie, the Countess of Wessex, also wandered through the NSPCC Garden and the Countess, who is Patron of the children&rsquos charity, heard how it&rsquos design reflects the charity&rsquos aim to protect children at risk by creating a safe and shielding environment.At the Feel Good Garden,&nbspSophie was presented with a posey from Dor Hastings, a volunteer at the flower show.The Queen is patron the Royal Horticultural Society which organises the Chelsea Flower ShowPrincess Beatrice arrived at the Chelsea Flower Show with her father Prince Andrew before the QueenThe Queen will also attend a private reception as part of her visit to the Chelsea Flower Show.Established in 1913, the flower show has become one of the world's biggest showcases for horticultural excellence, attracting visitors and exhibitors from across the globe.It has grown from 244 exhibitors in 1913 to more than 500 today, including gardens, nurseries, floristry, educational displays and trade stands. The show attracts 168,000 visitors.The show is organised by the Royal Horticultural Society, of which the Queen is patron.

title: royal wedding meghan markle prince harry celebrity guests behind the scenes
story: WireimageTROIAN BELLISARIOINSTAGRAMGuests shared behind-the-scenes snaps from the Royal WeddingFriends of the Royal Family usually do not reveal details of events that take place at Windsor Castle.But despite speculation mobile phones would be banned, some of Saturday&rsquos star-studded guest list took to social media to post pictures, video and their thoughts on the event.Patrick J Adams, who starred alongside Meghan Markle in the US legal drama Suits, posted a picture of himself and his wife, Troian Bellisario, in the grounds of the castle.The picture shows the pair and other guests basking in the sun and is captioned: &ldquoFreeloaders.                Royal wedding 2018: E-type Jaguar in pictures - does Harry own it?                Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's official wedding pictures: Who's who?Ms Bellisario, 32, went on to film herself inside the exclusive reception after removing her high heels and changing into a pair of white slippers which had been provided for guests.While walking barefoot inside the castle, she can be heard in the clip saying: How amazing is this? Because these shoes have come off. They have slippers for us.A man believed to be a member of the royal staff can be heard asking her: Would you like a pair madam?Meghan&rsquos best friend Jessica Mulroney also shared pictures from inside the reception party.Rick Hoffman posted a video explaining his 'bored' expression during the wedding ceremonyThe snaps offered a glimpse into to the stylish soiree and showed guests chatting before heading off to dinner.Rick Hoffman, Meghan Markle&rsquos Suits co-star, caused controversy when he posted a video explaining the reason behind his bored expression during the hour-long wedding ceremony.Images of the actor looking unimpressed as Meghan and Harry tied the knot quickly went viral, but he told his 686,000 Instagram followers he looked exasperated because he was sitting close to a guest with bad breath.In the clip he said: To answer any questions about the weird face that was made at the wedding.Wedding guests arriving at the royal wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle.                    Getty&bullPA1 of 69Wedding guests arriving at the royal wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle Jessica Mulroney shared pictures from the wedding receptionImagine sitting next to people to your right and not knowing which person it was that has halitosis.Hence the face that's apparently all over the place.He video was captioned with: &ldquoRoyal Wedding Face....#brushyourteethThe 47-year-old, who plays Louis Litt in the legal drama, later posted a video taken in the grounds of Windsor Castle which showed guests relaxing in the sun.WireimageAlmost 18 million Britons tuned in to the Royal Wedding coveragePrince Harry and Meghan Markle's royal wedding guests react to preacher Michael Curry's long speech.                    Sky News1 of 14Preacher Michael Curry gave a long a heart felt speech at Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's weddingSaturday&rsquos wedding was attended by a host of Meghan and Harry&rsquos celebrity friends who joined more than 30 members of the royal family to celebrate the happy couple&rsquos big day.George and Amal Clooney, Oprah Winfrey, Idris Elba and Serena Williams were just some of those lucky enough to receive invites.More than one hundred thousand people made the trip to Windsor to celebrate the wedding in person, while tens of millions tuned in around the world to watch the ceremony.Nearly 18 million people in the UK watched coverage of the nuptials, making it by far the biggest television event of the year.

title: royal wedding reception meghan markle dress kate middleton wedding dress
story: Meghan's second wedding dress for the evening reception was simple yet elegantThe Royal Wedding on Saturday had viewers gripped as Meghan walked down the aisle alone for the first portion of the procession, before walking arm in arm with Prince Charles.The walk down the aisle at St George&rsquos Chapel displayed her Givenchy dress at its finest, her veil trailing softly behind.Designed by Givenchy's Clare Waight Keller, the gown featured an open bateau neckline, three-quarter length sleeves, and five-metre long veil.Kensington Palace released the following statement about Meghan&rsquos wedding dress: The focus of the dress is the graphic open bateau neckline that gracefully frames the shoulders and emphasises the slender sculpted waist.                Queen back at work after Royal Wedding arriving at Chelsea Flower Show                Royal Wedding: Royal photographer shares his view of his big dayAfter the wedding, Meghan elected for a lily-white halter neck for her second dress, exposing her slender shoulders for the more relaxed reception.This second dress was designed by Stella McCartney and made of silk crepe, whilst her hair was styled in a loose bun.Meghan may have taken inspiration from Kate, who also changed into a simpler dress for her reception after her 2011 wedding.What did the Duchess of Cambridge wear on her wedding day?Kate and Prince William were married in Westminster Abbey on April 29, 2011.The bride-to-be wore a stunningly extravagant Sarah Burton for Alexander McQueen dress to say her vows, featuring lace sleeves, a train that measured just under 9ft and a v-shaped neckline.Kate&rsquos sister Pippa Middleton ensured the train looked at its best as Kate headed down the aisle, arm in arm with father Michael.After the wedding, Kate changed into another Sarah Burton for Alexander McQueen dress, this time slightly more relaxed for the reception.This dress was a strapless evening gown, with a circle skirt and with diamante detail around the waist. It was made from ivory satin and had a sweetheart neckline.Kate's second wedding dress was an elegant ballgown with complementary shrugTo complement the dress she wore a simple white shrug and finished the look with her hair down, softly curled at the ends.Kate and William held their reception at Buckingham Palace, whilst the new Duke and Duchess of Sussex had one reception at St George&rsquos Hall and a second intimate reception at Frogmore House, hosted by Prince Charles.

title: meghan markle royal wedding bouquet hidden messages princess diana flowers
story: Royal Wedding: Meghan Markle's bouquet had numerous symbols and hidden messages in the flowersDesigned by London-based florist Philippa Craddock, Meghan's bouquet comprised of sweet pea forget-me-nots, lily of the valley, astilbe, jasmine, astrantia and the royal tradition of myrtle flowers.At first glance, Meghan&rsquos bouquet appears more understated than the Duchess of Cambridge&rsquos.However, Orlando Hamilton a renowned florist and flower expert of 20 years, has revealed to Express there are hidden messages in Meghan&rsquos bouquet royal watchers may have overlooked.Describing Meghan&rsquos bouquet as &ldquocombining motifs and memories Mr Hamilton said the bride&rsquos choice in flowers had symbols of love and dedication.He told Express.so.uk: &ldquoFrom first glance Meghan&rsquos bridal bouquet is as understated as her chic couture wedding dress.                Queen back at work after Royal Wedding arriving at Chelsea Flower Show&ldquoOn closer inspection, her bouquet includes strong messages from royal tradition and the Victorian language of flowers.&ldquoMeghan is an ultra-modern royal bride in so many ways and yet there are some strong messages of royal tradition and continuity and clear links to the Royal Family in the choice of flowers in her bouquet.&ldquoI gather Prince Harry had a hand in choosing the flowers and most of these grow in the garden at their home at Kensington Palace &ndash this is a perfect way to mix the formal with the familiar.&ldquoIt sends a statement about this very modern royal couple.Describing each one of Meghan&rsquos flower choices, Mr Hamilton said: &ldquoMeghan&rsquos bridal bouquet contains a sprig of myrtle visible from the top, as is traditional for significant royal brides since the time of Queen Victoria and it will most likely be from a tree at Osborne House, Queen Victoria&rsquos favourite residence on the Isle of Wight.Meghan&rsquos bouquet had lily of the valley, a symbol of love, and astilbe signifying dedication&ldquoThe bouquet contained forget- me- nots which were among Princess Diana&rsquos favourite flowers.&ldquoIt also has lily of the valley, a floral symbol of love &ndash as in Kate Middleton&rsquos bouquet.&ldquoThe feathery white flowers are astilbe which in the Victorian Language of Flowers signifies dedication.&ldquoIt also contained sweet peas and jasmine, like lily of the valley, both delicate but exquisitely scented flowers.Royal wedding highlights: The best photos of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding day.                    Getty Images1 of 45Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding in pictures&ldquoIf you could get close enough to smell it, the scent would be amazing.Meghan, who became the Duchess of Sussex after the Queen bestowed the title of the Duke of Sussex on her husband Harry before the ceremony, has honoured the long-standing royal tradition of leaving her bouquet to rest on the grave of the Unknown Warrior at Westminster Abbey.The long-standing tradition started in 1923 when the Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon married the Duke of York &ndash the future Queen Elizabeth and King George VI.Meghan&rsquos bouquet has been placed on the grave of the Unknown Warrior at Westminster AbbeyThe Queen Mother laid her bridal bouquet on the Westminster Abbey tomb in memory of her brother, Fergus, who was killed at the Battle of Loos in 1915 during the First World War.Now, it has become tradition for royal brides to place their bouquet on the tomb a day after the wedding.The Duchess of Cambridge also honoured the tradition, and placed her bouquet on the tomb after her wedding to Prince William in 2011.

title: Galileo brexit news NASA RAF satellite launch britain european union EU
story: Part of the Galileo satellite being launchedDespite Britain contributing &pound1.2billion of the estimated &pound8.5billion into the experimental Galileo GPS system UK scientists will not be involved post-Brexit.As Britain prepares to leave the EU, the European Commission said it would &ldquono longer be appropriate for the country to be involved following Brexit in 2019.But today Britain hit back with the Ministry of Defence announcing plans for its own &pound4billion satellite navigation project.It is believed that the MoD will signal its intentions today to boost resources for a specialised space unit under control of the Royal Air Force.                Brexit news: UK could BLOCK future Galileo contracts amid tensions                Brexit news: EU shocking member states by pushing UK out of GalileoBritain has contributed &pound1.2billion of the estimated &pound8.5billion to Galileo The RAF will explore the military requirements for a UK global navigation system.Additionally, British officials will look to collaborate on the project with other close allies such as Canada, New Zealand, Australia and the US.Australia, which has recently announced plans to create its own space agency, is said to be interested in joining the UK on the project, two Whitehall officials told the Financial Times.Industry and Whitehall officials also told the outlet that Britain will take tenders for initial engineering and design over the next few months.Galileo will begin operating in 2019One source said: &ldquoFor the industry to carry out any work on a UK system they will need contracts.A recent study found that if the UK were to launch its own satellite system, it would bring in &pound3.7billion and create up to 5,000 jobs.The fact that there has been a study would suggest Britain has been pondering this idea for some time.The unnamed industry official told the Financial Times: &ldquoThis idea for a UK system has not suddenly appeared out of nowhere.Brussels has largely sought to entirely freeze Britain out of the Galileo project after its decision to leave the EU back in June 2016, which has created a series of rifts between the European Commission and Westminster.Since the project&rsquos launch in 2003, the UK has funded roughly 12 percent of Galileo&rsquos annual budget.EU bosses have maintained that Britain will lose access to Galileo as a result of Brexit, most notably the satellite navigation system&rsquos Public Regulated Service &ndash an Encrypted signal available to government agencies, militaries and emergency services.Brussels said sharing sensitive information with a third country &ndash which Britain becomes after Brexit &ndash &ldquoirretrievably compromises the service.

title: china news space race satellite launch dark side of the moon
story: China head to DARK SIDE of the moon: Beijing in groundbreaking satellite launchThe east Asian nation, which is recognised as one of the fastest growing space powers, launched Queqiao, a satellite which will allow communication between ground control and a probe on the dark side of the moon, early today, officials said.Zhang Lihua, manager of the relay satellite project, was quoted as saying by state-run Xinhua news agency: The launch is a key step for China to realise its goal of being the first country to send a probe to soft-land on and rove the far side of the moon.The English translation of Queqiao is &ldquomagpie bridge and the satellite is now successfully orbiting between the Earth and the moon.One side of the Moon is always facing Earth thanks to the gravitational pull of tides on Earth, a process known as &ldquotidal locking.                Jupiter cyclones captured in stunning images taken by Nasa&rsquos Juno                Aliens found? Scientists discover fresh evidence of life on EuropaThe launch of QueqiaoNo group has ever managed to send a probe to the other side of the Moon due to the communication difficulties it presents &ndash signals would struggle to reach there from Earth.But Queqiao will act as a relay point between the dark side of the moon and Earth so ground control can remain in contact with the probe.The Chinese probe that will land on the dark side of the moon later this year and, if the mission is successful, the nation will achieve a feat that no other has managed to do and confirm itself as a major player in the space exploration game.Zou Yongliao of the Chinese Academy of Sciences' moon exploration department, has previously said by landing a probe on the dark side of the moon, it will &ldquofill a void in experts&rsquo understanding of the universe.A selection of space images following Apollo 11's successful moon landing in 1969.                     1 of 10Astronaut Edwin Aldrin walks by the footpad of Apollo 11. This is because the dark side of the Moon has a clean electromagnetic environment, which provides an ideal field for low frequency study.He added: &ldquoIf we can place a frequency spectrograph on the far side, we can fill a void.Wu Yanhua, the deputy chief of the China National Space Administration (CNSA), added China is also exploring the possibility of sending a man to the moon and hopes to send probes to Jupiter and its moons.He said: Our overall goal is that, by around 2030, China will be among the major space powers of the world.

title: alien asteroid news space astronomy solar system jupiter 2015 BZ509
story: Alien asteroid from 4.5 BILLION years ago discovered in solar system in major BREAKTHROUGHLate last year, scientists discovered the asteroid 'Oumuamua which travelled through our solar system after arriving from another star.While the cigar-shaped asteroid passed through the solar system, scientists began theorising that asteroids could have come from far away and then stayed.This has now been confirmed after scientists found a space rock called 2015 BZ509.The asteroid was actually first discovered in 2014, but after four years of tracking it, scientists have been able to determine that the rock arrived in our solar system some 4.5 billion years ago &ndash just as Earth was beginning to form.                Asteroid the size of the Great Pyramid of Giza to shoot past Earth                ASTEROID WARNING: Astronomers lose track of asteroidsC. VeilletLarge Binocular Telescope ObservatoryAsteroid 2015 BZ509The asteroid orbits the sun clockwise &ndash the opposite way to all the planets &ndash and is in the same path as Jupiter.Astronomer and cosmologist Fathi Namouni of the Observatoire de la C&ocircte d'Azur in France said: How the asteroid came to move in this way while sharing Jupiter's orbit has until now been a mystery.If 2015 BZ509 were a native of our system, it should have had the same original direction as all of the other planets and asteroids, inherited from the cloud of gas and dust that formed them.After running computer simulations on the asteroid, they found that it has been there for 4.5 billion years and it will continue on that path for 43 billion more years &ndash although this will not happen as our sun would have burned out by that point.The first asteroid was Ceres, discovered by Giuseppe Piazzi in 1801. There are currently over 600,000 known asteroids in our solar system. Most asteroids are found orbiting in the Asteroid Belt, a series of rings located between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.                    Getty Images1 of 10There are Millions of Asteroids in the solar system, usually found in the Asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter, however those in that pass the Earth are called Near-Earth objectsStudy co-author Helena Morais of the Universidade Estadual Paulista, Brazil, said: Asteroid immigration from other star systems occurs because the Sun initially formed in a tightly-packed star cluster, where every star had its own system of planets and asteroids.The close proximity of the stars, aided by the gravitational forces of the planets, help these systems attract, remove and capture asteroids from one another.

title: Brexit news UK EU Theresa May European Union Douglas Carswell
story: Former Conservative Party and Ukip MP Douglas Carswell has ripped into the &ldquopolitical elite that are defying the democratic will of British people.The Brexit supporter claimed Remainers were using two different techniques to try to stop Britain from cutting ties with Brussels.He said: &ldquoIt&rsquos two years since we voted to leave the European Union.&ldquoTo put that into context, that&rsquos 17-and-a-half million people, the largest mandate for any democratic decision every taken in our country&rsquos history.FOXNEWS&bullBrexit news: Douglas Carswell ripped into the political elite for trying to block Brexit&ldquoAnd two years on, the political elite are trying to stop Brexit. They are doing it in two different ways.&ldquoThey are trying to delegitimise the result.&nbspFirst,&nbspthey are saying that voters were misled, that voters were betrayed, there was something underhand about the Vote Leave campaign.&ldquoThe second thing they are doing is they are blazingly trying to use the law through court cases and the House of Lords, an unelected body of appointees to try to change the Brexit legislation so we leave in name only.Speaking to Fox News, the Brexiteer added: &ldquoThis is the most extraordinary and frankly outrageous decision imaginable.The comments come after the House of Lords defeated the Government a total of 15 times with amendments to the Withdrawal Bill.The amendments from the unelected chamber&nbsphas&nbspleft the door open for Britain to remain in the customs union, as well as joining the EEA post-Brexit.Prime Minister Theresa May has clashed with her cabinet over the country&rsquos future customs relationship with the European Union.Mrs May&rsquos customs partnership model was rejected by Brexiteers in her cabinet with Boris Johnson branding the plan &ldquocrazy.Brexiteers favour a &ldquomaximum facilitation model &ndash otherwise known as &ldquoMax Fac &ndash which uses technology and a trusted trader scheme to seriously limit the number of customs checks.David Davis meets EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier in Brussels ahead of a crunch meeting of European Union leaders later this week                    AFPGetty Images1 of 10British Brexit minister David Davis (L) and EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier meet at the European Commission in BrusselsSpeaking on Thursday last week, Prime Minister Mrs May said: &ldquoWe have been very clear that we will be leaving the customs union and in&nbspfuture&nbspoutside of that customs union be able to develop our own independent trade policy&ldquoAs we look forward to developing our economic partnership with the European Union once we have left, it will be necessary for there to be arrangements as to how matters are to be dealt with across borders in relation to customs.&ldquoWe are committed&nbspin&nbspleaving the customs union and as we look to that future economic partnership, ensuring that we have a relationship that enables us to have as frictionless a trade with the European Union as possible.&ldquoThat we also deal with the issue in the Irish government that we do not have a hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland but also that we are able to have an independent trade policy.&ldquoThat is what we will be doing and ensuring that at the end of the implementation period - as form the end of December 2020 - we will be able to operate an independent trade policy.

title: Met office weather forecast UK weather heatwave May Bank holiday
story: NetweatherThe outlook from Saturday, May 26 to Monday, May 28 is set to be &ldquomostly fine and sunny. The outlook from Saturday, May 26 to Monday, May 28 is set to be &ldquomostly fine and sunny, according to the Met Office&nbspforecast.&nbspThere may be some early mist and fog, but that should soon clear.&nbspIt will be &ldquowarm or very warm for the south and west, but eastern coasts could see things run a little cooler.&nbspScattered thunderstorms could affect southern and central areas at times, so it might not be totally safe to leave the umbrellas at&nbsphome.&nbspThere will also be a brisk easterly wind across southern areas.&nbsp                UK weather forecast: Britain to BAKE in high pressure                BBC Weather: UK to ROAST in sunshine before HEAVY thunderstorms HITHowever, certain areas will enjoy a glorious bank holiday, with temperatures forecast to top 26 degrees celsius in London.&nbspAll across the country should see some sunshine, with no rain forecast at all on Saturday, as shown on the Met Office map below.&nbspConditions into June are still uncertain.&nbspAccording to the Met Office website: &ldquoInto the beginning of June confidence is low, but it will most likely remain overall drier and&nbspwarmer than average.&ldquoHowever there will be an increasing chance of more unsettled, cooler conditions developing.Met OfficeCertain areas will enjoy a glorious bank holiday, with temperatures forecast to top 26 degreesGettyIt will be &ldquowarm or very warm for the south and westThese unsettled periods of June are likely to bring periods of rain or showers across large parts of the country.&nbspHowever, there should still be some nice warm spells, particularly for those of us down south.The Met Office went so far as to&nbspsuggest &ldquovery warm spells in our future.&nbspThis continued warm weather is thanks to a high pressure system moving over Britain from Europe, bringing with it sunshine and&nbspclearing the skies.&nbspFor the rest of this week however, we can all expect to see some ups and downs, with rain and scattered thunderstorms across the&nbspcountry.&nbspBut once we&rsquove made it through that we should have a fair bit of summery weather to enjoy this weekend.&nbsp

title: royal wedding meghan markle flowers hospice queen dressmaker gift
story: PAMrs Clayton, 89, worked on the wedding dress worn by the Queen in 1947Pauline Clayton, 89, a patient at St Joseph's Hospice I Hackney, east London, was one of the main needleworkers who worked on the wedding dress worn by the Queen when she married Prince Phillip in November 1947.A selection of flowers from the day were sent to the charity, including white garden roses, peonies and foxgloves that surrounded the couple on the big day.But, to their surprise, staff at the hospice had only learnt that the needlewoman had worked for Sir Norman Hartnell after the Royal Wedding had finished.A delighted Mrs Clayton said that the bouquet was lovely. title: Brexit news Michael Gove immigration brexit referendum update brexit latest
story: The prominent Leave campaigner told a Policy Exchange conference on unionism in London that the act of &ldquotaking back control has encouraged Britain to be &ldquomore welcoming to migration.He said: &ldquoThe Brexit vote was a vote of confidence in Britain.&ldquoFor the first time in my adult lifetime we voted to take power back from unaccountable institutions and return it to accountable UK politicians.&ldquoThat is an assertion of belief in Britain which I think we should celebrate.&ldquoSupporters of the values that underpin the UK and the ersity which is its strength cannot afford to be complacent.&ldquo                SHOCK WARNING: &lsquoNo doubt fares will rise&rsquo Ryanair&rsquos O&rsquoLeary warns                DUP slams &lsquoDISGRACEFUL&rsquo Blair using Northern Ireland in Remain plotThe Environment Secretary said the Leave vote had dealt a blow to the identity politics put forward by parties like the SNP and Ukip.Mr Gove continued: Another feature of unionism, the explicit embrace of ersity has strengthened since Brexit.Britain has become more welcoming to migration since the Brexit vote as opinion research has confirmed.The act of taking back control has allowed British citizens to show that they can be more welcoming to new arrivals if allowed to be rather than required to be.And now Britain is one of those EU nations with the warmest attitude towards migration, mirroring the attitudes in sister countries across the globe such as Canada and New Zealand.Brexit news: Michael Gove issued a rousing defence of BrexitMr Gove said he did not believe Brexit would lead to Northern Ireland exiting the UK&nbspand suggested support for Scottish independence had fallen.He added: Brexit has, certainly so far, strengthened unionist currency in our politics, not weakened it.Since the vote to leave the European Union in 2016, support for Scotland leaving the United Kingdom has diminished.Arlene Foster, speaking at the same event, blasted Tony Blair and John Major for the &ldquodisgraceful way they &ldquoused Northern Ireland despite knowing what they were claiming was &ldquonot the case during the Brexit referendum campaign.It's feared the UK&rsquos transition deal with the European Union will leave the its fishing industry at the EU's mercy                    PA1 of 7UK fishermen fear the EU will impose laws that shrink British fishing fleets She said: &ldquoI do think it is quite disgraceful that they used Northern Ireland in that way, because they know that&rsquos not the case.&ldquoOne of the most bizarre pieces around the referendum in Northern Ireland was when the Remain campaign sent Tony Blair and John Major to Londonderry to speak in favour of remaining in the European Union.&ldquoIf they thought that those two iniduals were going to shift people to vote Remain - I thought it was quite bizarre.&ldquoIt is wrong for people like John Major, like Tony Blair to do all of that - very wrong.

title: national living wage uk 2018 increase minimum wage 16 18 25
story: But the amount is still below the Real Living Wage, a voluntary scheme to which thousands of employers including retailers, local authorities and charities have got involved.The National Living Wage is the amount of money all employees aged over 25 are legally entitled to.It used to be known as the National Minimum Wage, but it was re-branded in 2016.The National Living Wage increased from £7.50 to £7.83 for those aged 25 and over.The 33 pence-an-hour rise was introduced on Sunday April 1, 2018.The compulsory National Living Wage was introduced in 2016.The first National Minimum Wage was set in 1998 by the Labour government.Mr Hammond is aiming to get the wage to £9 by 2020.The National Minimum Wage is the amount which workers aged under 25, but of school-leaving age, are entitled to.However, the amount differs depending on age and whether the worker is on an apprenticeship scheme.Workers aged 21-24 were paid £7.05 - and it went up to £7.38 from April 1, 2018.The wage increased from £5.60 to £5.90 for 18 to 20-year-olds, and from £4.05 to £4.20 for under 18s.However, apprentices were only entitled to £3.50 if they are under-19 - this increased to £3.70 from April 1, 2018.In April 2018, the minimum wage for 25-year-olds rose from £7.50 to £7.83 an hour.The national limits are legally binding.Anyone who thinks they are not getting the National Living Wage or National Minimum Wage should complain to their employer in the first instance.If this does not get anywhere, the next step is to take the complaint to HMRC who will investigate.Those who are self-employed, voluntary workers, company directors and family members who live in the home of the employer and do household chores do not qualify for either rate.There is no difference in pay for those that live in London compared to elsewhere.The only discrepancy is for people working in agriculture or horticulture.Workers already employed before October 1, 2013 are entitled to the pay set under their contract of employment.This is a voluntary scheme aiming to recognise the actual cost of living, to which 3,000 employers have signed up.Under it, the lowest rate of pay is calculated according to the cost of living in the UK based on the changing cost of a basket of groceries.The amount is set by the charity Living Wage Foundation, and accredited employers include local authorities, NHS trusts, banks, retailers, charities and construction companies.The foundations calculations put the real Living Wage at £8.75 an hour - and £10.20 in London.These rates also apply to over-18s in recognition that young people face the same living costs as everyone else.And while companies are not legally entitled to pay more than the National Living and Minimum Wages, those which have signed up to the real Living Wage scheme have pledged to pay all workers those rates.The rate is calculated every November, and accredited employers are committed to any increases.While theres no legal obligation for your employer to pay you more than the National Living Wage (£7.50 from April 1, 2017), if your company is accredited by the Living Wage Foundation you should be receiving more than that.The foundations head of partnerships Graham Griffiths said anyone concerned can use their online whistleblowing service, and any employer not adhering to the Real Living Wage faced losing its accreditation.Graham said one area where it was challenging to pay the living wage were retail and hospitality but pointed to Ikea, Aldi and Lidl, which have agreed to pay the same rate.The scheme was launched in 2001 by parents in East London, and the foundation was set up in 2011.In 2005 following a growing interest from employers, the Greater London Authority established the Living Wage Unit to calculate what the lowest pay should ideally be.In 2008 Trust for London selected the scheme as a special initiative and made a grant of more than £1million to campaign for it and set up an accreditation scheme for employers.In April 2016 it became the inspiration for the governments higher minimum wage rate, which it rebranded the National Living Wage.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: next line throne prince harry royal family tree charles king
story: Prince Charles is next in line to the throne, but how does the rest of the royal lineage and Prince Louis line up? Here is the lowdown...The throne will pass to Prince Charles if the Queen abdicates, retires or dies – and according to reports, abdication could be a real possibility.Her Majesty is said to have told her inner circle that if she is still on the throne at the age of 95, she will ask for a piece of legislation to grant her eldest son full power to reign while she is alive.Royal commentator Robert Jobson told the Mail On Sunday he has spoken to a number of high-ranking courtiers who say preparations for the transition of the Crown are gaining pace.And at this years Commonwealth Heads of Government meeting, The Queen said she wished for Charles to succeed her as head of the group of countries.Next in line after Charles is eldest son Prince William, the Duke of Cambridge, and then his children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and the new baby boy, Prince Louis.Prince Harry - who was third in line to the throne in 2013 - is now sixth in line.Following his wedding to Meghan Markle, any children that they produce would come after him in the line of succession.The rules of Royal succession have changed significantly in recent years.Leaders of 16 British Commonwealth countries (including Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Jamaica) voted in 2011 to alter the centuries-old tradition to include daughters as well as sons.Previously daughters could only inherit the throne if there were no living sons.This system, which dated back 300 years, is based on the rules of primogeniture which gives preference to the firstborn male heirs of a king or queen.This change in royal succession means Princess Charlotte, as William and Kates daughter, is ahead of her younger brother.Previously if the third child was male he would leap the princess in the line of succession.This new rule only takes into account children born after 2011, meaning Prince Edwards youngest child, James, born in 2007, is ahead of his older sister, Louise, born in 2003.Commonwealth leaders also decided in 2011 to remove the rule that no heir could assume the throne if he or she married a Roman Catholic.Then Prime Minister David Cameron said at the time: “The idea that a younger son should become monarch instead of an elder daughter, simply because he is a man just isn’t acceptable anymore.Nor does it make any sense that a potential monarch can marry someone of any faith other than Catholic.“The thinking behind these rules is wrong.The Roman Catholic rule can be traced to the 16th-century reign of Henry VIII.The King broke with the Roman Catholic Church to divorce his wife, Queen Catherine, and marry Anne Boleyn.The changes, under the Succession to the Crown Act 2013, came into force in March 2015 but apply to people born after October 28, 2011.Live Science reported that because one of the duties of the British monarch is to head the Church of England, no Roman Catholic can hold the crown.The basis for the succession was determined in the 17th century.When James II fled the country in 1688, Parliament held that he had abdicated the government and that the throne was vacant.The throne was then offered, not to Jamess young son, but to his daughter Mary and her husband William of Orange, as joint rulers, following the Glorious Revolution.At 69-years-old, Prince Charles is the longest-serving heir in UK history - having been first in line from the age of three - and would become the oldest ever British monarch to take the throne.Some royalists have argued that Prince Charles should step aside to allow Prince William to become King because he enjoys better approval ratings with the public based on a poll last year.Prince Charles has faced controversy over his divorce from Princess Diana and his affair during their marriage with wife Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall.He has also been accused of “meddling” in politics by stating his opinion on issues like the environment and farming, alternative medicine and architecture in private letters to Government ministers.In 1936, Edward VIII - the Queens uncle - famously abdicated after less than a year on the throne so he could marry divorcee Wallis Simpson.Prince Harry says no Royal wants to be King or Queen — but they would do it for “the greater good”.The 33-year-old said: “Is there any one of the Royal Family who wants to be king or queen?I don’t think so, but we will carry out our duties at the right time.”He told Newsweek magazine: “We are involved in modernising the British monarchy.We are not doing this for ourselves but for the greater good of the people.”And he insisted the Royals were still vital, adding: “We don’t want to dilute the magic.“The British public and the whole world need institutions like it.”The long-serving royal is stepping back from a public role after 65 years of Royal duties.His final solo engagement was The Captain General’s Parade in August 2017, when he saluted the Royal Marines at Buckingham Palace.Due to English common laws, he cannot become king.The wife of a king is known as a Queen Consort, and takes the title of Queen – although she doesn’t rule as the monarch.But if a female royal marries a man with a title below her own - as in the case of Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip - she will retain the title while her husband will not be entitled to it.He is known as Prince Consort.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes.
